title: Add a prelude: standard library written in bukowski
description: Add a prelude.bk file that gets loaded before user code. Define map, fold, filter, length (for lists), and other standard functions using Y and the core primitives â€” written in bukowski itself rather than as native Ruby builtins in the reducer. This would replace the native apply_map and apply_fold implementations, proving the language is expressive enough to define its own standard library. Consider: how does the prelude interact with define/defun (bukowski-5)? Definitions need to persist in the environment.
